from typing import cast, Dict, List, Optional

from axiestudio.base.memory.memory import BaseMemoryComponent
from axiestudio.field_typing import Text
from axiestudio.helpers.record import records_to_text
from axiestudio.schema.schema import Record
from pymongo import MongoClient
from pymongo.collection import Collection


class MongoDBMessageReaderComponent(BaseMemoryComponent):
    display_name = "MongoDB Memory Reader"
    description = "Retrieves chat messages from MongoDB based on session ID."
    icon = "history"

    def build_config(self) -> Dict:
        return {
            "connection_string": {
                "display_name": "MongoDB Connection String",
                "info": "The connection string to connect to MongoDB.",
                "input_types": ["Text"],
            },
            "database_name": {
                "display_name": "Database Name",
                "info": "The name of the MongoDB database.",
                "input_types": ["Text"],
            },
            "collection_name": {
                "display_name": "Collection Name",
                "info": "The name of the MongoDB collection.",
                "input_types": ["Text"],
            },
            "session_id": {
                "display_name": "Session ID",
                "info": "The session ID of the chat history.",
                "input_types": ["Text"],
            },
            "order": {
                "options": ["Ascending", "Descending"],
                "display_name": "Order",
                "info": "Order of the messages.",
                "advanced": True,
            },
            "n_messages": {
                "display_name": "Number of Messages",
                "info": "The number of messages to retrieve.",
            },
            "sender_name": {
                "display_name": "Sender Name",
                "advanced": True,
            },
            "sender": {
                "options": ["Machine", "User", "Machine and User"],
                "display_name": "Sender Type",
                "advanced": True,
            },
            "record_template": {
                "display_name": "Record Template",
                "multiline": True,
                "info": "Template to convert Record to Text. If left empty, it will be dynamically set to the Record's text key.",
                "advanced": True,
            },
        }

    def get_messages(
        self,
        memory: Collection,
        **kwargs,
    ) -> List[Record]:
        """
        Retrieves messages from MongoDB for the given session ID and other parameters.
        """
        # memory: Collection = cast(Collection, kwargs.get("memory"))
        # if not memory:
        #     raise ValueError("pymongo.collection.Collection object is required.")

        session_id = kwargs.get("session_id")
        n_messages = kwargs.get("n_messages")
        sender_name = kwargs.get("sender_name")
        sender = kwargs.get("sender")
        order = kwargs.get("order")

        query = {"session_id": session_id}

        if sender_name:
            query["sender_name"] = sender_name

        if sender == "Machine and User":
            query["sender"] = {"$in": ["User", "Machine"]}
        else:
            query["sender"] = sender

        cursor = memory.find(query)

        if order == "Ascending":
            cursor.sort("timestamp", 1)
        elif order == "Descending":
            cursor.sort("timestamp", -1)

        cursor.limit(n_messages)

        records = []
        for document in cursor:
            record_data = {
                "sender_name": document["sender_name"],
                "text": document["text"],
                "timestamp": document["timestamp"],
            }
            records.append(record_data)

        return [Record(data=record_data) for record_data in records]

    def build(
        self,
        connection_string: Text,
        database_name: Text,
        collection_name: Text,
        session_id: Text = None,
        sender_name: Optional[Text] = None,
        sender: Optional[Text] = "Machine and User",
        n_messages: int = 5,
        order: Optional[str] = "Descending",
        record_template: Optional[str] = "{sender_name}: {text}",
    ) -> Text:

        client = MongoClient(connection_string)
        memory = client[database_name][collection_name]  # pymongo.collection.Collection
        messages = self.get_messages(
            memory=memory,
            session_id=session_id,
            n_messages=n_messages,
            sender_name=sender_name,
            sender=sender,
            order=order,
        )
        messages_str = records_to_text(template=record_template or "", records=messages)
        self.status = messages_str
        return messages_str


# Example usage:
# reader = MongoDBMemoryReader('mongodb_connection_string', 'database_name', 'collection_name')
# messages = reader.get_messages(session_id='123456', n_messages=10)
